content:
[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide]

# NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.header: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide | 关键词: ACL

content:
[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Access Control Lists (ACLs) Overview]

## Access Control Lists (ACLs) Overview

ACLs (Access Control Lists) are used to filter traffic on an interface. 
Cumulus Linux supports standard and extended ACLs for IPv4 and IPv6.

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide

content:
## Access Control Lists (ACLs) Overview

ACLs (Access Control Lists) are used to filter traffic on an interface. 
Cumulus Linux supports standard and extended ACLs for IPv4 and IPv6.

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Configuring ACLs with NVUE]

## Configuring ACLs with NVUE

To configure an ACL, you define rules and attach them to an interface.

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary: Configuring ACLs with NVUE | 关键词: ACL

content:
## Configuring ACLs with NVUE

To configure an ACL, you define rules and attach them to an interface.

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Configuring ACLs with NVUE > Creating an ACL]

### Creating an ACL

To create an ACL named 'block-telnet' that denies TCP traffic on port 23:

```bash
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 action deny
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip protocol tcp
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-port 23
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip source-ip any
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-ip any
```

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary:
Creating an ACL | 命令: nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 action deny
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip protocol tcp
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-port 23
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip source-ip any
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-ip any
``` | 关键词: ACL

content:
### Creating an ACL

To create an ACL named 'block-telnet' that denies TCP traffic on port 23:

```bash
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 action deny
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip protocol tcp
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-port 23
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip source-ip any
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 10 match ip dest-ip any
```

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Configuring ACLs with NVUE > Permitting Other Traffic]

### Permitting Other Traffic

Always remember to permit other traffic if the default policy is deny, or implicit deny exists:

```bash
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 action permit
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 match ip protocol any
```

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary:
Permitting Other Traffic | 命令: nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 action permit
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 match ip protocol any
``` | 关键词: ACL

content:
### Permitting Other Traffic

Always remember to permit other traffic if the default policy is deny, or implicit deny exists:

```bash
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 action permit
nv config set acl block-telnet rule 999 match ip protocol any
```

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Configuring ACLs with NVUE > Attaching ACL to Interface]

### Attaching ACL to Interface

Apply the ACL to an interface (e.g., swp1) in the ingress direction:

```bash
nv config set interface swp1 acl ingress block-telnet
```

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary:
Attaching ACL to Interface | 命令: nv config set interface swp1 acl ingress block-telnet
``` | 关键词: ACL, SWP1

content:
### Attaching ACL to Interface

Apply the ACL to an interface (e.g., swp1) in the ingress direction:

```bash
nv config set interface swp1 acl ingress block-telnet
```

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Configuring ACLs with NVUE > Verifying Configuration]

### Verifying Configuration

To show the configured ACLs:

```bash
nv show acl
```

To check the rules of a specific ACL:

```bash
nv show acl block-telnet
```

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary:
Verifying Configuration | 命令: show the configured ACLs:

```bash
nv show acl
```

To check the rules of a specific ACL:

```bash

``` | 关键词: ACL

content:
### Verifying Configuration

To show the configured ACLs:

```bash
nv show acl
```

To check the rules of a specific ACL:

```bash
nv show acl block-telnet
```

[NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide > Troubleshooting ACLs]

## Troubleshooting ACLs

If traffic is not being filtered as expected:

1. Check the rule order (rules are processed sequentially).
2. Verify the ACL is applied to the correct interface and direction (ingress/egress).
3. Use `nv show acl <name> statistics` to see hit counts.

breadcrumbs: NVIDIA Cumulus Linux ACL Configuration Guide
metadata.summary: Troubleshooting ACLs | 命令: nv show acl <name> statistics` to see hit counts. | 关键词: ACL

content:
## Troubleshooting ACLs

If traffic is not being filtered as expected:

1. Check the rule order (rules are processed sequentially).
2. Verify the ACL is applied to the correct interface and direction (ingress/egress).
3. Use `nv show acl <name> statistics` to see hit counts.
